> The study of the rise and fall of populations, inter- and intraspecific  interactions - with a strong flavor of conservation biology and management. 


### Course Materials

This course is co-taught by Drs. [Elie Gurarie](https://www.esf.edu/faculty/gurarie/) and [Joshua Drew](https://www.esf.edu/faculty/drew/).   This page compiles the lectures, labs, problem sets and links to simulation tools for **Dr. Gurarie's** portion of the course (roughly weeks 5-11 - starting February 12).  The page will be populated as the course progresses, but a link to previous year's [archives](archive2023/index.html) is below.

## Problem Sets / Homework

- [**Problem Set 3: On Otters and Elephants**](problemsets/ProblemSet3.html)
    - due **Monday, February 26, 2024**. 
    - This homework requires downloading this data file: [BC_SeaOtters.csv](data/BC_SeaOtters.csv) and experimenting with the [Stochastic Population Simulator](https://egurarie.shinyapps.io/StochasticGrowth/). 


- [**Problem Set 4: Fitting the Human Wolf Simulation**](problemsets/ProblemSet4/FittingHumanWolves.html)
    - due **Friday, March 8, 2024**. 
    - This homework requires downloading this data file: [WolfCounts2024.csv](problemsets/ProblemSet4/WolfCounts2024.csv). 

- [**Problem Set 5: Rescuing the Tasmanian Devil**](labs/labII.4/AgeStructuredPopulations.html#Homework_Assignment3)
    - due **Thursday, March 21, 2024**.
